verses.roman:
śravaṇe, darśane ākarṣaye sarva-mana
āpanā āsvādite kṛṣṇa karena yatana

synonyms: śravaṇe—in hearing; darśane—in seeing; ākarṣaye—attracts; sarva-mana—all minds; āpanā—Himself; āsvādite—to taste; kṛṣṇa—Lord Kṛṣṇa; karena—makes; yatana—efforts.
translation: All minds are attracted by hearing His sweet voice and flute, or by seeing His beauty. Even Lord Kṛṣṇa Himself makes efforts to taste that sweetness.
